intro: Kosteletzkya thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's sea oxeye, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has a succulent, sprawling growth habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to coastal conditions with high salinity and wind exposure.
